scenarios.title: After-School Job Dilemma
scenarios.summary: You need money for a family bill, but your manager schedules you during a major exam week.

step1.prompt: Your manager schedules you for two extra shifts during exam week. You need the money, but the exams are major.
aiPrompts: I can only give these shifts to someone who is reliable. Can you do it?
Let me know quickly. I have to finalize the schedule today.

choices.text: Accept all shifts and plan to study late.
choices.consequence: You earn money but lose study time and feel stressed.

choices.text: Negotiate for one shift and explain your exam week.
choices.consequence: You balance income and study time, but the manager is uncertain.

choices.text: Decline and focus on exams.
choices.consequence: You protect study time but lose income.

step2.prompt: A parent asks how you will cover the family bill this month.
aiPrompts: We need to know your plan so we can cover the gap.
I want you to succeed in school, but we also have to pay the bill.

choices.text: Propose a budget plan and ask for temporary support.
choices.consequence: The parent feels heard and agrees to help short-term.

choices.text: Promise to cover it without a clear plan.
choices.consequence: You avoid conflict now but risk breaking trust later.

choices.text: Ask to delay the payment and focus on exams.
choices.consequence: You buy time but increase financial pressure.

step3.prompt: Your friend offers to share answers for one exam to reduce stress.
aiPrompts: No one will know. It just makes this week easier.
You have too much on your plate. Take the help.

choices.text: Refuse and explain your values and long-term goals.
choices.consequence: You keep integrity and lower long-term risk.

choices.text: Accept the answers to reduce stress.
choices.consequence: Short-term relief but major academic and trust risks.

scenarios.title: Group Project Breakdown
scenarios.summary: Your team is behind and one member is disengaged right before the due date.

step1.prompt: One teammate has not done their section. The project is due in 48 hours.
aiPrompts: I was busy. I can do it tonight, just give me time.
Please don’t tell the teacher yet.

choices.text: Set a clear deadline and offer help to finish tonight.
choices.consequence: You keep collaboration but add work to your schedule.

choices.text: Reassign their section to other team members.
choices.consequence: The project quality improves, but resentment grows.

choices.text: Tell the teacher immediately and document the issue.
choices.consequence: You protect your grade, but it affects team relationships.

step2.prompt: The teammate sends a partial draft. It is not high quality.
aiPrompts: I did what I could. It’s not perfect, but it’s something.
Can you just fix it?

choices.text: Revise it and give feedback for next time.
choices.consequence: You secure the grade but carry extra workload.

choices.text: Ask them to revise with specific expectations.
choices.consequence: You reinforce accountability but risk delays.

choices.text: Replace their section without discussion.
choices.consequence: Quality improves but trust takes a hit.

step3.prompt: The teacher asks for a reflection on how the team handled the conflict.
aiPrompts: Be honest. How did your team handle responsibility and communication?
What would you do differently next time?

choices.text: Describe the conflict and your conflict-resolution strategy.
choices.consequence: You show growth and apply unit language.

choices.text: Avoid details and keep it surface-level.
choices.consequence: You miss a chance to show learning.

scenarios.title: Online Pressure and Reputation
scenarios.summary: A rumor spreads online and you are asked to respond publicly.

step1.prompt: A rumor about you is spreading in a group chat. People want a response now.
aiPrompts: You should clap back. Everyone is watching.
If you stay quiet, people will think it’s true.

choices.text: Pause, gather facts, and set a plan before responding.
choices.consequence: You reduce risk and stay in control.

choices.text: Respond immediately and defend yourself.
choices.consequence: You feel relief but may escalate the situation.

choices.text: Ignore the messages and hope it fades.
choices.consequence: You avoid conflict but lose control of the narrative.

step2.prompt: A teammate asks if the rumor is true and if it affects your role.
aiPrompts: I need to know if this is a team issue. What’s your plan?
Help me understand the facts.

choices.text: Explain the facts calmly and outline your response plan.
choices.consequence: You build trust and show leadership.

choices.text: Get defensive and blame others.
choices.consequence: Trust drops and the issue escalates.

step3.prompt: You decide how to respond publicly. Your post will be seen by peers and adults.
aiPrompts: Think about how this will look a week from now.
Do you want to post at all, or use a private message?

choices.text: Address it privately and focus on repairing trust.
choices.consequence: You reduce public drama but need patience.

choices.text: Post a calm public response with facts and boundaries.
choices.consequence: You show leadership but risk further attention.

scenarios.title: Family Budget Emergency
scenarios.summary: A sudden expense hits your household and you are asked to help decide priorities.

step1.prompt: A car repair bill arrives. The family budget is short this month.
aiPrompts: We need to decide what to cut this month. What’s your plan?
I’m stressed. We have to choose wisely.

choices.text: List essential expenses and propose cuts to non-essentials.
choices.consequence: The plan reduces risk and keeps essentials covered.

choices.text: Avoid the conversation and hope it works out.
choices.consequence: Short-term comfort but long-term risk increases.

choices.text: Suggest a short-term loan without reviewing the terms.
choices.consequence: Immediate relief but potential future burden.

step2.prompt: A sibling asks to keep a planned event that costs money.
aiPrompts: It’s not fair. I already invited people.
Can’t we just do this one thing?

choices.text: Offer a lower-cost alternative and explain the trade-off.
choices.consequence: You protect relationships and the budget.

choices.text: Say no without explanation.
choices.consequence: You save money but damage trust.

step3.prompt: You need to explain the plan to the family.
aiPrompts: How will you explain this plan so everyone buys in?
What will you do if people push back?

choices.text: Communicate the plan and ask for input.
choices.consequence: Shared ownership increases follow-through.

choices.text: Dictate the plan quickly and move on.
choices.consequence: It saves time but weakens buy-in.

scenarios.title: Play Through an Injury?
scenarios.summary: A coach wants you to play, but your injury might worsen.

step1.prompt: You twisted your ankle at practice. The coach wants you to play in a big game.
aiPrompts: We need you out there. Can you push through?
It’s a big game. What can we do to make this work?

choices.text: Agree to play without getting medical advice.
choices.consequence: You help the team now but risk long-term injury.

choices.text: Ask for medical guidance before deciding.
choices.consequence: You protect your health and make a informed choice.

choices.text: Decline and focus on recovery.
choices.consequence: Short-term disappointment but long-term health is protected.

step2.prompt: Your teammates are disappointed and ask you to reconsider.
aiPrompts: We need you. It’s only one game.
Can you at least play part of it?

choices.text: Explain your long-term goals and health boundaries.
choices.consequence: You model self-regulation and protect health.

choices.text: Give in to pressure and play anyway.
choices.consequence: Team is happy but risk increases.

step3.prompt: A parent asks how you decided.
aiPrompts: Walk me through your thinking.
What trade-offs did you consider?

choices.text: Describe your decision-making steps and trade-offs.
choices.consequence: You show clear reasoning and values.

choices.text: Say it was no big deal.
choices.consequence: You miss a chance to show growth.

scenarios.title: Late-Night Ride
scenarios.summary: A friend offers a ride home late at night, but you are unsure about safety.

step1.prompt: A friend offers a ride home late at night. You are unsure if they are a safe driver.
aiPrompts: It’s fine. We’ll get there fast.
Don’t be dramatic. I do this all the time.

choices.text: Pause and suggest a safer plan (call a guardian or use a safer route).
choices.consequence: You reduce risk and model responsible decision-making.

choices.text: Accept the ride to avoid conflict.
choices.consequence: You save time but accept more risk.

choices.text: Decline the ride and wait for another option.
choices.consequence: You prioritize safety but it takes longer.

step2.prompt: Your guardian texts asking for your plan to get home safely.
aiPrompts: I need to know where you are and how you’re getting home.
What’s your plan?

choices.text: Share your plan and ask for support.
choices.consequence: You build trust and keep safety first.

choices.text: Be vague to avoid questions.
choices.consequence: You risk trust and increase uncertainty.

step3.prompt: Reflect on the decision you made about safety and pressure.
aiPrompts: What was the biggest risk?
What would you do if this happened again?

choices.text: Describe your risk assessment and how you managed pressure.
choices.consequence: You show transfer of decision-making skills.

choices.text: Say it wasn’t a big deal.
choices.consequence: You miss an opportunity to show growth.
